results.title: And yet it moves
results.brief_description: This film provides a look at how animators use their imagination; it also shows the materials they use. The film is divided into sections which show the creation of brief but effective story lines or commentaries in various media. Plasticine becomes a gracefully moving woman; another blob becomes a comic singer complete with cape; an egg revolves, bounces and catches fish.

results.title: Walking for physical fitness
results.brief_description: Explains the importance of correct footwear when walking, the benefits of walking and the pleasures walking can bring to all who participate. An informative and motivational film of those who enjoy walking as part of their recreational pursuits.

results.title: Aerobic exercising
results.brief_description: Aerobic exercising is shown as a means to enhance lifestyle and increase lifespan. Emphasizes the need for sensible preparation for any fitness program including aerobics, as well as giving attention to safety aspects.

results.title: Business: what's it all about?
results.brief_description: This film presents the operations of four different companies relating to basic business functions, problems, skills needed and the importance of business in everyday life. Shows that certain concepts are common to any business such as profit, the distinction between products and services, research and development, production and manufacturing marketing and distribution. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Growing together
results.brief_description: Parents of children aged from two to five years speak about the problems and joys of dealing with children at this age. Provides some insight into the nature of child development during this period. Companion film toe “One and one makes three”.

results.title: The Boy who liked deer
results.creator_credit: Barbara Loden and Material Worth Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Learning to be human”.
Three boys think nothing of their vandalism of school property and a deer park, until as a result of their crimes some deer die of food poisoning. Provides a personal look at the problem of vandalism by showing the teacher’s grief over the destruction of his classroom and the sorrow of one of the boys over the fate of the deer. Suitable for primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Forests and wood
results.creator_credit: Justin Milne, Lesley Hammond, New Films and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Pinus radiata is shown to be a reliable and versatile source of timber. The life cycle of the pine is traced from the propagation through planting to initial thinning and clear felling. The milling process is then examined along with kiln drying and treatment with protective chemicals. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Man hunters
results.brief_description: An introduction to the study of fossil homo sapiens, this film provides a starting point for more detailed discussions. Presents a time line upon which only a small part represents recorded history, the rest is pre-history. The film also discusses a 100 year search by scientists for the earliest evidence of human existence. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Apemen of Africa
results.brief_description: The processes involved in pinpointing the appearance of humans on earth are discussed in this film. Fossils discovered in South Africa in 1924 bore evidence that humans first appeared in Africa, not Asia, contrary to prevailing scientific opinion. Shows how further discoveries by anthropologists proved without doubt the existence of a human-like creature who lived in Africa as long as three and a half million years ago. Narrated by E. G. Marshall
